context: The Finnish word 'suostua' is an intransitive verb that means to agree, consent, or accept something. It typically expresses someone's willingness to do or accept something voluntarily. The word changes form depending on the subject and tense: suostuu (he/she agrees), suostuivat (they agreed), suostuisin (I would agree). When used negatively with 'ei', it indicates refusal: ei suostunut (didn't want to/agree).
